title: Peaceful!
review: this place is peacefull where you can find smthing that you cant find in the crowdy city Agara elsewhere.

title: british time church
review: St George’s Cathedral is an example of traces of the Christian population that settled during the Colonial Era in India.

title: Peace of mind
review: The place where you can get peace of mind.

title: Nice & Clean and good place for prayers
review: Idealy located with good parking space and the gathering is also limited. This gives ample space to concentrate.

title: ST. GEORGE’S CATHEDRAL
review: One hardly views Agra to be anything other than a Mughal city with Indo-Persian monuments. St George’s Cathedral is an example of traces of the Christian population that settled during the Colonial Era in India.

title: nice church of british period
review: It is a magnificently beautiful building of yellow color with white dressings.The church is constructed in conventional style. It has a very small gateway for entrance. The interior is divided into a central core point and side corridor by six classical columns, carrying a slightly concave or domed roof. Later on, the cathedral in the eastern end has been gothicized with a carved white sandstone screen and the church table was prepared with what Agra is famous for i.e., the marble inlay work.

title: Anglican Church with English Service & holy Communion.
review: St. George,s Cathedral is the seat of the Bishop of the Agra diocese. The church was established by the British for the high ranking British officers & since then the service continues to be in English language only.

title: British Time Church
review: Experience Nostalgia at its peak at this British Church of the 20th Century , There is regular service and mass held but I just visited and found silence and a amazing bond to this place established. Excellent Place - Do Visit!
